questions.question: When did Kyrgyzstan declare its independence?
questions.explanation: Independence was declared in 1991 after the USSR collapsed.

questions.question: What is the capital of Kyrgyzstan?
questions.explanation: The capital is Bishkek (formerly called Frunze in Soviet times).

questions.question: Which large mountain range covers much of Kyrgyzstan?
questions.explanation: Most of the country is mountainous, part of the Tien Shan.

questions.question: Which famous lake in Kyrgyzstan is known for not freezing completely in winter?
questions.explanation: Issyk-Kul is slightly salty and deep; it rarely freezes.

questions.question: The flag’s 40 rays around the sun symbolize…
questions.explanation: The 40 rays represent the legendary 40 tribes unified in Kyrgyz history.

questions.question: What is shown in the center of the sun on the flag?
questions.explanation: The tündük is the top opening of a traditional nomadic yurt.

questions.question: Which epic poem is a key part of Kyrgyz national identity?
questions.explanation: The Epic of Manas is central to Kyrgyz culture and oral tradition.

questions.question: What was the capital’s Soviet-era name?
questions.explanation: Bishkek was called Frunze during the USSR period.

questions.question: Which empire ruled parts of Central Asia in the 10th–12th centuries and influenced Kyrgyz lands?
questions.explanation: The Karakhanids were a major Turkic dynasty in the region.

questions.question: Kyrgyz lands came under the Russian Empire mainly in which century?
questions.explanation: Most incorporation happened in the 1800s.

questions.question: The Kyrgyz Soviet Socialist Republic (Kyrgyz SSR) was established in:
questions.explanation: It became a union republic of the USSR in 1936.

questions.question: What is Kyrgyzstan’s national currency?
questions.explanation: The som has been the currency since the early 1990s.

questions.question: Which city is one of the oldest in the country and a hub in the south?
questions.explanation: Osh is an ancient city on historic Silk Road routes.

questions.question: Which countries border Kyrgyzstan?
questions.explanation: Kyrgyzstan borders Kazakhstan, Uzbekistan, Tajikistan, and China.

questions.question: A traditional Kyrgyz horseback game where riders fight over a goat carcass is called:
questions.explanation: Kok-boru is a famous nomadic sport, also known as buzkashi regionally.

questions.question: Which drink is a well-known traditional beverage in Kyrgyzstan?
questions.explanation: Kymyz is widely known in Kyrgyz nomadic culture.

questions.question: Which statement about Issyk-Kul is true?
options: It is an endorheic (closed) lake with slight salinity
questions.explanation: Issyk-Kul has no outlet and slightly saline water.

questions.question: Kyrgyz is the state language; what is the status of Russian?
questions.explanation: Russian has official status for interethnic communication.

questions.question: The renaming from Frunze to Bishkek happened in:
questions.explanation: The city returned to the name Bishkek in 1991.

questions.question: Which peak is among Kyrgyzstan’s highest?
questions.explanation: Jengish Chokusu (also called Pobeda/Victory Peak) is one of the highest.
